Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of palmette in added white outline with alternating added red and black petals; lotus-palmette in white outline with red centres above two white bands; exterior: row of blobs at rim above maeander pattern between pairs of narrow bands; below, dot and billet pattern; below, pendant lozenge and rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as coming from a light-walled and big chalice belonging to the Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices. Chalices that fall into this group are usually large and heavy-walled and are also known as chalice kraters. Chalices in this group display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 90, p. 262, no. 536)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1551) (phase 2)
